_id.title: The unique id of the benchmarking event. If it is possible, it should be something meaningful, like an URL

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to BenchmarkingEvent

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

url.title: The link to the benchmarking event

community_id.title: The community id where this benchmarking event belongs

references.title: The benchmarking event reference id(s) (if any)

BenchmarkingEvent.title: Benchmarking Event concept (ELIXIR-EXCELERATE WP2 Benchmarking schemas)

_id.title: The unique id of the contact. It should be whatever ELIXIR AAI uses as public unique user id (for instance, a URI)

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to Contact

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

email.title: The e-mail address(es) of the contact

links.title: Optional links related to the contact

_id.title: The unique id of the dataset. If it is possible, it should be something meaningful

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to Dataset

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

version.title: Version (or relelase date) of the dataset

datalink.title: The link to the dataset itself

dataset_contact_id.title: The contact id(s) of the creators of this dataset

metrics.title: The different metrics generated from this dataset

references.title: The reference id(s) of this dataset (if any)

_id.title: The unique id of the community status. It should be something meaningful, like a short word or an acronym

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to CommunityStatus

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

CommunityStatus.title: Community Status concept (ELIXIR-EXCELERATE WP2 Benchmarking schemas)

_id.title: The unique id of the metrics.

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to Metrics

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

metrics_contact_id.title: The contact id(s) of the creators of this metrics

links.title: Optional links related to the metrics

_id.title: The unique id of the bibliographic reference. It should be something meaningful, like its DOI or its PubMedId

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to Reference

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

doi.title: The DOI of the referenced material (in case of books, its ISBN in ISBN-A DOI format)

pubmed_id.title: The PubMed id of the referenced material (if any)

abstract.title: Optionally, the abstract of the referenced material

links.title: Optional links related to the bibliographic reference

authors.title: Optional list of authors of the referenced material

Reference.title: Bibliographic reference concept (ELIXIR-EXCELERATE WP2 Benchmarking schemas)

_id.title: The unique id of the test event.

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to TestEvent

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

tool_id.title: The tool id which takes this input dataset

input_dataset_id.title: The id of the input dataset

output_dataset_id.title: The id of the output dataset (if available)

benchmarking_event_id.title: The id of the benchmarking event where this test event was generated

result_report.title: Relevant information about the status changes

metadata.title: Relevant metadata used to call the tool

TestEvent.title: Test Event concept (ELIXIR-EXCELERATE WP2 Benchmarking schemas)

_id.title: The unique id of the tool access type. It should be something meaningful, like a short word or an acronym

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to ToolAccessType

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

description.title: Description of this tool access type

ToolAccessType.title: Tool Access Type concept (ELIXIR-EXCELERATE WP2 Benchmarking schemas)

_id.title: The unique id of the tool. It should be something meaningful, like the tool name, its uri or an acronym

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to Tool

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

bioTools_id.title: The unique id of the tool in EXCELERATE WP1 bio.tools registry

is_automated.title: Can this tool be automatically invoked?

community_id.title: The community id(s) where this tool belongs

_id.title: The unique id of the tool status. It should be something meaningful, like a short word or an acronym

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to ToolStatus

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

ToolStatus.title: Tool Status concept (ELIXIR-EXCELERATE WP2 Benchmarking schemas)

_id.title: The unique id of the community. It should be something unique of the community (for instance, an acronym)

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to Community

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

links.title: Optional links related to the community

community_contacts.title: _id of the contacts of the responsible researchers in charge of the community coordination

_type.title: The document type. In this case, fixed to Contact

_version.title: The document type version. In this case, fixed to 0.2

email.title: The e-mail address(es) of the contact

links.title: Optional links related to the contact

uri.title: The URI of the link related to the community

creation.title: Creation date of the benchmarking event

modification.title: Last modification date of the benchmarking event

uri.title: The URI of the link related to the contact

modification.title: Last modification date of the dataset

metrics_id.title: The id of the metrics as such

result.title: The results obtained from the metrics

uri.title: The URI of the link related to the metrics

contact_id.title: If it is a known contact, its contact id

creation.title: Creation date of the test event

modification.title: Last modification date of the test event

reception.title: Last reception date of the output dataset (redundant, as the output dataset already has this date)

link.title: The link to the access point
